title: Madayyagari Mallana
text:
Mallana (15th century) was a <a href="Telugu%20language">Telugu</a> <a href="poet">poet</a> and one of the "<a href="Astadiggajas">Astadiggajas</a>" (literally means eight elephants) in the <a href="noble%20court">court</a> of the <a href="monarch">king</a> <a href="Krishnadevaraya">Krishnadevaraya</a>.
Biography.
He said that his birthplace was part of <a href="Rayalaseema">Rayalaseema</a> (means land ruled by Rayas, <a href="Vijayanagara">Vijayanagara</a> kings) in his works. He accompanied Krishnadevaraya in his military travels. He dedicated his work to Nadendla Appana (popularly known as Appaji), the governor of <a href="Kondavidu">Kondavidu</a> and nephew of a Minister called Saluava Timmana in the <a href="Vijayanagara%20Empire">Vijayanagara Empire</a>.
Works.
His popular work is "Rajasekara Charitram" on the military and romantic conquests of Rajasekara, a king of <a href="Avanti%20%28India%29">Avanti</a>.
Style.
Like other poets of Prabhanda (fiction) period, his story seems completely original and there is no <a href="Sanskrit">Sanskrit</a> equivalent to it. Compared to his contemporaries, he is restrained in presenting romance.
